page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The block is mainly grazing farmland. In the SW corner is the village of {Tideswell}(population 2000).The old part of Tideswell is a{Conservation {Area.}The A673 runs through the northern part,and is crossed by the B6049 which runs through Tideswell. Wheston,(pop.40) is a hamlet about 2km WNW of Tideswell. The area is in that part of the{Peak {National Park}called The White Peak;so named from the underlying limestone which has been used for walls ,and which in the sunlight show as white lines across the landscape. Many people in Tideswell work in surrounding quarries or allied trades, but a few commute to nearby towns. There is some light industry as well as tourist and other services. The following pages are mainly about Tideswell,and its people.
